newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft to upgrade Microsoft Network.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to upgrade Microsoft Network.

text.p: Microsoft Corp said Monday it has released a preview version of its Microsoft Network (MSN) Internet online service.
The upgrade, which will be released in the fourth quarter of 1997, includes a new e-mail system, various performance enhancements and improved installation.

MSN's new e-mail system will work with Microsoft Internet Explorer 3.0 and higher and allows members of MSN to exchange file attachments with other online services and e-mail systems. Microsoft's advanced messaging tool Outlook Express will be incorporated into MSN by the end of the year. Outlook Express has an Internet address book which allows users to find e-mail addresses for millions of people in the Internet white pages. Users can also sort incoming e-mail according to subject, author, file size and date allowing the elimination of unwanted e-mail.
